page.title: 09Ditton Funday
page.content: On Sunday 7th July it was Ditton Funday at the Community Centre. There was a procession of decorated floats and people in fancy dress. Stalls were set up round an arena. At 3.30 there were children's sports. In the hall were things that adults and children had made for competitions (cakes, flower displays, art etc.). In another part of the hall a clown was doing tricks and there were shows such as Jack & the Beanstalk. Outside was the Custard Pie Championship. Teams in fancy dress had to throw pies at each other. It was very funny to watch. In the Egg-Hurling competition you had to throw an egg and your partner had to catch it without it smashing. Over on the other side of the field, people were trying to put up a hot-air balloon. Finally they did get it into the air. - Kerri, aged 10.-
